alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Monroe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 2:48AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN MONROE AND SOUTHERN CUMBERLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 215 AM CDT... At 147 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Tompkinsville to 10 miles northwest of Celina. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Tompkinsville, Littrell, Meshack, Modoc, Blythe, Harlan Crossroads, Green Grove, Vernon, Peytonsburg, and Stalcup. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent lightning is occurring with these storms. Seek safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
